intro: Peucedanum selinoides, commonly known as giant cowparsley, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, compound leaves that resemble those of parsley. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its aromatic foliage and historical use in traditional medicine highlight its botanical and ecological significance.
